content.title: Mechanochemical Ablation (MOCA/ClariVein)
content.description: Non-thermal endovenous ablation combining mechanical damage to vein endothelium with simultaneous sclerosant injection.

mechanism.mechanical: Rotating wire tip (3500 RPM) damages endothelium
mechanism.synergy: Mechanical damage allows better sclerosant penetration

content.device: ClariVein catheter with rotating tip and infusion port

procedure.activation: Rotate and slowly withdraw while infusing sclerosant

advantages.no_thermal: No risk of thermal nerve injury
advantages.ssv: Potentially safer for SSV (sural nerve proximity)

disadvantages.efficacy: Some studies show slightly lower closure rates vs thermal
